noun.description: A numerical quantity (found empirically to be constant over a wide range of temperature) equal to the molecular weight of a liquid multiplied by the fourth root of its surface tension and divided by the difference between the density of the liquid and that of its vapour.

origin: 1920s. From para- + ancient Greek χορός dance, but taken by S. Sugden as if having the sense space, by mistake for χώρα.
